void Pl050::mouseAt ( uint16_t  x,
uint16_t  y,
uint8_t  buttons 
) [virtual]

called whenever the mouse moves or it's button state changes buttons is a simple mask with each button (0-8) corresponding to a bit position in the byte with 1 being down and 0 being up

Parameters:
x the x position of the mouse
y the y position of the mouse
buttos the button state as described above

Implements VncMouse.

Member Data Documentation

int Pl050::ackNext [protected]

If the controller should ignore the next data byte and acknowledge it.

The driver is attempting to setup some feature we don't care about

Definition at line 113 of file kmi.hh.

Bitfield<1> Pl050::clk_in [protected]

Definition at line 82 of file kmi.hh.

uint8_t Pl050::clkdiv [protected]

clock divisor register This register is just kept around to satisfy reads after driver does writes.

The divsor does nothing, as we're not actually signaling ps2 serial commands to anything.

Definition at line 97 of file kmi.hh.

Referenced by read(), serialize(), unserialize(), and write().
